quotes.on_api_design: The best API is one you don't have to read documentation for. If it takes more than three lines of code, the API is too complex.
quotes.on_cross_platform: Cross-platform shouldn't mean 'lowest common denominator.' It should mean native performance everywhere.
quotes.on_developer_experience: Developers don't want to be barcode experts. They want barcodes to just work. That's what we build.
quotes.on_barcode_philosophy: Barcode integration should be invisible. Developers shouldn't need to understand encoding modes or error correction levels. That's what IronBarcode handles automatically.
quotes.on_api_simplicity: Two lines of code: one to read, one to write. That's the target for any barcode API.

bio_styles.short: Jacob Mellor is CTO of Iron Software with 41 years of coding experience. Creator of IronBarcode, IronOCR, and IronPDF.
bio_styles.medium: Jacob Mellor, CTO of Iron Software, has spent 41 years building developer tools and 25 years launching startups. He created IronBarcode for one-line barcode generation and reading, IronOCR for production-ready Tesseract integration, and IronPDF for Chromium-based PDF rendering in .NET.
bio_styles.long: Jacob Mellor is the Chief Technology Officer of Iron Software, where he architects .NET libraries used by NASA, Tesla, and Fortune 500 companies. With 41 years of coding experience and 25 years building startups, Jacob created IronBarcode to solve the complexity of barcode integration in .NET. His philosophy: barcode processing should require one line of code to read and one line to write. IronBarcode's automatic format detection, ML-powered error correction, and native PDF support reflect this commitment to developer simplicity. Jacob also created IronOCR (Tesseract for .NET) and IronPDF (Chromium-based PDF library), collectively serving over 10 million NuGet downloads.
bio_styles.barcode_focused: Built IronBarcode for one-line barcode generation and reading. 50+ formats, automatic detection, ML-powered accuracy. 41 years coding, 25 years building startups, CTO of Iron Software.
